required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Super-Bolus: Effects on Postprandial Glycemia After High Glycemic Index Meal
clinical_study.official_title: Effects of Super-Bolus on Postprandial Glycemia After High Glycemic Index Meal in Children With Type 1 Diabetes Mellitus- Randomized Study

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of this study is to determine whether Super-Bolus is more effective in postprandial glycemic control than Normal-Bolus after the high glycemic index (H-GI) meal in children with type 1 diabetes (T1DM) treated with insulin pump (continuous subcutaneous insulin infusion, CSII).

primary_outcome.description: Postprandial blood glucose excursion measured by self monitoring of blood glucose (SMBG)

secondary_outcome.description: Hypoglycemia defined as a plasma glucose concentration below or equal 70mg/dl with or without symptoms
Measurements based on Continuous Glucose Monitoring System (CGMS)
MAGE will be defined as a standard deviation of blood glucose (SDBG) obtained from all blood glucose concentrations

secondary_outcome.measure: Capillary blood glucose level 30,60,120,150,180 min after administration of the prandial bolus

secondary_outcome.description: a difference between baseline and the maximum glucose value based on CGMS
the maximum value of glycemia during 3 hours of postmeal time based on CGMS

secondary_outcome.measure: Time in postprandial glucose range between 70 to 180 mg/dl (4.0-10.0 mmol/L)

arm_group.description: Pre-breakfast insulin will be given as a Normal Bolus 15 minutes before the high-glycemic index meal (cornflakes and milk). The Normal Bolus will be calculated based on individual insulin-to-carbohydrate ratio (ICR).

Pre-breakfast insulin will be given as a Super Bolus 15 minutes before the high-glycemic index meal (cornflakes and milk). The Super Bolus will be calculated based on individual ICR increased to 150% and basal insulin will be suspended for 2 hours at the same time.

intervention.description: A type of bolus insulin will be insulin glulisine if participant used insulin glulisine before entering the trial.
A type of bolus insulin will be insulin aspart if participant used insulin aspart before entering the trial.
A type of bolus insulin will be insulin lispro if participant used insulin lispro before entering the trial.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- duration of type 1 diabetes longer than 12months,
- insulin pump therapy longer than 3 months,
- written informed consent to participate in the study signed by parents (and patient older than 16 years).
Exclusion Criteria:
- celiac disease,
- diabetes related complications (e.g. nephropathy),
- BMI at or above the 95th percentile and at or below 3rd percentiles for children and teenagers of the same age and sex,
- withdrawal of consent to participate in the study,
- comorbid conditions and treatment which could significantly affect glycemic values in the researchers' opinion.

overall_official.affiliation: Department of Pediatrics, Medical University of Warsaw

facility.name: Department of Pediatric Diabetology and Pediatrics, Pediatric Teaching Clinical Hospital
